justification: Acknowledges Team B’s playoff-schedule focus and upside appetite, and the pieces partly fit B’s tastes. However, it overlooks B’s tendency to buy injured stars (trading away Logan Clark), and ignores Team A’s injury aversion and urgent need for immediate production. Calling Josh Robinson a “true workhorse” clashes with his Tier 5 value. Team A giving up a Tier 1 RB and healthy QB for an Out QB is misaligned with their win-now needs. Rationale is brief and under-evidenced.
